trends: There have been 13 other sightings in Glendale
There were no other sightings in Glendale on or around October 14th 2012
Summary: Starlike in the line below orion's belt, flashing crazy colors moving slow and randomly, 2 nights in a row
divs: Sighting DetailsMe and a friend were outside my home up in the hills near Glendale community college in Glendale, California, two nights in a row now, when it gets dark and the stars come out, there's this bizzare starlike object, looks so different from all other stars in many ways: 1) it's lower (closer to horizon) than all other stars, 2) it's brighter and constantly changing colors randomly, red, green, blue, purple, 3) me and my friend were staring at it for a while, ten fifteen minutes straight and both came to the conclusion that it is not stationary, moving so slightly that u had to stare at it a while to notice the movement, goes left, stops, right, stops, towards us, stops, back, stops, all so slowly, always changing color. We pointed it out to a visitor arriving and he noticed movement as well. Just so bizzare, what is this please tell me? It has been two nights in a row now. It's still out there, anyone can see it. If u draw a line down towards the horizon starting from orion's belt, it's right along that line...
